title: Attempted homicide defendant wants release due to COVID-19
title_page: Attempted homicide defendant wants release due to COVID-19
maintext:
LA CROSSE, Wis. (AP) — A La Crosse County judge has denied a request to lower bond for a man charged with shooting and wounding a police officer.
An attorney for 35-year-old Allen Kruk had asked that the defendant be released on a signature bond with house arrest so he wouldn’t be at risk of contracting the new coronavirus in jail.
Judge Ramona Gonzalez denied that request Tuesday.
The La Crosse Tribun e reports Kruk has been in the La Crosse County Jail on a $50,000 bond since he was charged Sept. 6 with attempted first-degree intentional homicide using a dangerous weapon and several other counts.
Kruk is accused of shooting La Crosse Officer Dustin Darling last summer once in his bullet proof vest after the officer responded to a domestic call.
Kruk’s trial remains scheduled for July.
